intro: Calobota namibensis, commonly known as the Namibian rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the hyperarid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant is adapted to extreme drought conditions, with a compact growth form and a deep root system to access limited water. Its leaves are succulent, helping to reduce water loss, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom during brief rainy seasons. Calobota namibensis is an important component of the unique flora of the Namib Desert ecosystem.
